items.title: Rakuten justifies mobile losses with AI investment: CEO
items.author: Hiroshi Mikitani
items.summary:
- Hiroshi Mikitani, CEO of Rakuten, highlights the company's mobile division's role in AI growth.
- Rakuten, in Japan’s wireless market for four years, reports ongoing financial losses.
- The mobile segment has over 8 million users and leverages user data for AI applications.
- Rakuten plans to develop an AI assistant for shopping and travel markets.
- Former Google expert Ting Cai has been hired to advance Rakuten's AI technologies.

items.title: ‘Been there, done that’ isn’t enough: a VC’s founder playbook
items.summary:
- Recent data indicates that repeat entrepreneurs secure more funding than first-time founders.
- Venture capitalists often prefer experienced founders, but this does not guarantee success.
- Assessing first-time founders involves evaluating their character, integrity, and ability to manage substantial funds.
- First-time founders are often overwhelmed and need to demonstrate multitasking skills, known as "helicopter" skills.
- Reference checks can reveal important insights about a founder's character and past experiences.

items.title: Japan’s startup funding, as explained in charts
items.summary:
- Article offers insights into Japan's startup funding landscape through charts and data.
- Divided into weekly updates featuring notable investors and companies.
- Includes macro trends analysis of funding across different verticals and stages.

items.title: UK confirms no plans to ban TikTok
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- The UK government has confirmed that there are no current plans to impose a ban on TikTok.
- This decision reflects a recent trend among several countries reconsidering bans on the popular social media platform.
- UK officials emphasize that discussions regarding cybersecurity are ongoing, but no formal actions against TikTok have been taken.

items.title: Oyo set to file IPO by Q1 FY25: sources
items.summary:
- Oyo plans to file its draft red herring prospectus (DRHP) for an IPO by Q1 FY25.
- This is Oyo's third attempt to go public after two previous withdrawals.
- The IPO follows restructuring and debt financing, with early investors like Lightspeed Venture Partners looking to sell stakes.
- Oyo reported its first ever profit of 229 crore rupees (US$26.49 million) for FY24 and 132 crore rupees (US$15.27 million) for Q1 FY25.
- Recent developments include notable funding rounds and acquisitions, enhancing its market position.

items.title: Airwallex names new marketing VP for APAC
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Airwallex appoints Andrew Balint as VP of marketing for APAC, excluding China.
- Balint will lead marketing in Australia, New Zealand, Singapore, Hong Kong, and Malaysia, effective immediately.
- He has 25 years of marketing experience, previously serving as VP of marketing for ANZ and Asia-Pacific at Afterpay.
- Balint's responsibilities include branding, integrated campaigns, growth marketing, and partnerships.
- Airwallex reports an 83% year-on-year revenue increase in APAC for 2024.

items.title: Edtech firm BrightChamps acquires India’s Edjust
items.author: Dushyant Panchal, Anmol Mittal, Sanjay Panikar
items.summary:
- BrightChamps acquires Edjust, an Indian K12 education marketplace, in a cash and stock deal.
- This is BrightChamps’s fourth acquisition since 2020, following Education10x, Schola, and Metamorphosis Edu.
- Edjust, founded in 2022, has a presence in the US and UK, focusing on edtech services with AI and data systems.
- Post-acquisition, Edjust’s founders will expand the sales model across BrightChamps' operating regions.
- Edjust's team will develop a new distribution channel for core academic subjects like mathematics, science, and English.

items.title: TikTok restored in US amid legal risks for providers
items.summary:
- TikTok regained access in the US on January 20, 2025, following the expiration of the congressional mandate for divestment from ByteDance.
- Service providers like Oracle, Apple, and Google may face legal risks continuing to operate TikTok, with potential fines reaching up to US$5,000 per user.
- Over 170 million users and 7 million small businesses could be impacted by these legal actions.

items.title: Meta to launch video editing app for creators on iOS
items.summary:
- Meta is launching a new video editing app named "Edits" next month, announced by Instagram head Adam Mosseri on Threads.
- The app will first be available on iOS, with an Android version planned for later.
- Edits will feature a high-quality camera, tools for organizing ideas, an inspiration tab, and a draft sharing option for collaborations.
- Users will access performance insights for their published videos on Instagram.

items.title: Mobility platform Rapido expands to 500 cities in India
items.summary:
- Rapido plans to expand its mobility services to 500 cities in India starting from February 2025.
- The expansion will initially target Karnataka, Gujarat, Tamil Nadu, West Bengal, and Rajasthan.
- Services will further extend to Punjab, Haryana, Uttar Pradesh, and Uttarakhand, with specific timelines yet to be confirmed.
- Founded in 2015, Rapido competes with Uber, Ola, and other emerging companies like Namma Yatri.
- The platform has completed over 200 crore rides, averaging 3.6 million daily rides.

items.title: TikTok aims to restore services for US users
items.summary:
- TikTok is working to restore full functionality in the US for over 170 million users.
- US authorities assured service providers they won't face penalties for supporting TikTok.
- The platform has an impact on over 7 million small businesses in the US.
- No details on the agreement or timeline for resuming services have been provided.

items.title: Industry operator optimist on Taiwan’s humanoid robot role
items.author: Yen Jui-hsiung
items.summary:
- Taiwanese manufacturers could significantly impact the humanoid robot supply chain, as stated by Yen Jui-hsiung, chairman of Tongtai Machine & Tool Co., Ltd.
- Local firms have the capability to produce vital components for humanoid robots, such as harmonic drives and planetary gearboxes.
- High manufacturing costs pose a challenge to making humanoid robots more accessible.
- Yen's remarks follow Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang's visit to Taipei, where he explored collaboration opportunities with Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. (TSMC) in robotics and self-driving vehicles.

items.title: KKR, UAE’s Gulf data hub to invest over $5b in data centers
items.summary:
- KKR and Gulf Data Hub (GDH) to invest over $5 billion in Gulf data center infrastructure.
- This is KKR’s first investment of this kind in the region.
- KKR has acquired a stake in GDH for an undisclosed amount.
- The investment will be managed through KKR's infrastructure division, overseeing $77 billion in assets.
- The agreement was signed in the presence of UAE ministers Thani Al Zeyoudi and Omar Al Olama.

items.title: Nvidia, TSMC partner to advance silicon photonics for AI
items.summary:
- Nvidia has partnered with TSMC to advance silicon photonics technology.
- The announcement was made by CEO Jensen Huang after a meeting with TSMC Chairman C.C. Wei.
- The partnership is in early stages, with expected significant outcomes in the coming years.
- Silicon photonics offers benefits like lower energy consumption, reduced costs, and increased transmission distances.

items.title: Seven Indian startups join US space, defense tech program
items.summary:
- Seven Indian startups selected for the India-US space and defense collaboration program focused on dual-use technology.
- The program, initiated in September 2024 by Indusbridge Ventures and FedTech, connects startups with the US Defense Innovation Unit and Department of Defense.
- Selected companies include KaleidEO (space imaging), EtherealX (rocket manufacturing), and Shyam VNL (AI technology).
- Startups will work on satellite observation and space defense projects while gaining mentorship and industry connections.
- The initiative may lead to partnerships with US defense companies like Northrop Grumman and Lockheed Martin.

items.title: Trump adviser open to TikTok’s continued Chinese ownership
items.summary:
- Mike Waltz, incoming National Security Adviser, indicated TikTok may remain under Chinese ownership if data protection is ensured.
- TikTok has ceased operations for its 170 million US users due to a ban over data misuse concerns.
- Trump’s team might grant a 90-day extension after inauguration to assess the situation, allowing TikTok to evaluate potential buyers.
- Republican leaders suggest Trump might push ByteDance to divest from TikTok altogether.

items.title: Jio Platforms Joins Crypto Space with JioCoin Launch
items.summary:
- Jio Platforms introduced JioCoin, a reward token on the Polygon blockchain, on January 16.
- JioCoin is integrated into JioSphere, Jio’s web browser, as reported by users on X.
- This launch represents Reliance Industries’ entry into the virtual currency sector amidst ongoing cryptocurrency debates in India.
- Regulators, including the Reserve Bank of India, express concerns over privately issued digital currencies despite the global interest in blockchain technology.

items.title: Honey, I shrunk the LLM: why leaner is meaner
items.author: Sri Ambati
items.summary:
• Large language models (LLMs) like ChatGPT have significant potential, but must be cheaper and leaner for wider adoption.
• Costs for LLM-powered applications can range from US$500,000 to US$1 million each, leading to high overall expenses for companies.
• Specialized small language models (SLMs) are proposed as efficient alternatives, with examples like H2O.ai’s Danube, which has versions with far fewer parameters than larger models like GPT-4.

items.title: VPN interest rises amid US TikTok ban
items.summary:
- Increase in Google searches for Virtual Private Networks (VPNs) in response to TikTok restrictions in the US.
- VPNs enable users to mask locations, encrypt activities, bypass restrictions, and enhance privacy.
- TikTok is unavailable in US app stores as of January 18, 2025, potentially impacting 170 million users ahead of a legal ban.

items.title: KKR hires Goldman to sell stake in PH fintech Maya: sources
items.summary:
- KKR has engaged Goldman Sachs for the potential sale of its minority stake in Philippine fintech Maya.
- KKR owns over 20% of Maya, which could be valued at more than US$2 billion.
- KKR initially invested in Maya in October 2018 during a US$175 million funding round alongside Tencent Holdings.
- In April 2022, Maya raised US$210 million, achieving a valuation of US$1.4 billion for its digital banking services.

items.title: Indian SaaS startup raises $2m seed
items.summary:
- TreZix, a SaaS startup from Surat, India, has raised $2 million in seed funding.
- The funding was co-led by Morphosis Venture Capital and Pentathlon Ventures.
- TreZix plans to expand operations in India and the US with the new funding.
- The startup aims to launch import and export solutions for 15 industries in the next 3-6 months.
- Founded in 2020, TreZix focuses on enhancing cross-border trade through its platform, connecting businesses with various stakeholders.

items.title: Amazon leads in corporate renewable energy with 33gw projects
items.summary:
- Amazon added 100 new renewable energy projects, totaling over 33 gigawatts in capacity.
- This makes Amazon the largest corporate buyer of renewable energy, surpassing Apple by over 10 gigawatts.
- The portfolio includes utility-scale wind and solar farms, capable of powering 8.3 million homes.
- Renewable energy contracts have helped reduce Scope 2 emissions despite growth in energy-intensive operations.
- Scope 3 emissions remain a challenge in Amazon's decarbonization strategy.
- The company aims for net zero carbon emissions by 2040, with updates in the 2024 sustainability report.

items.title: Fleet tech firm becomes India’s first unicorn in 2025
items.summary:
- NetraDyne has achieved unicorn status with a valuation of US$1.34 billion in 2025.
- The company raised US$90 million in a series D funding round recently.
- Founded in 2015, NetraDyne is based in Bengaluru and California, utilizing AI for driver monitoring and safety.
- They track 700 million miles monthly and serve over 3,000 clients globally.
- NetraDyne reported US$210 million in revenue for 2024, marking a 65% increase, largely due to growth in the US market.

items.title: Indian waste management startup raises $4.1m series A
items.author: Abhishek Gupta, Abhinav Vashistha
items.summary:
- WeVois, a waste management startup in Jaipur, secured ₹36 crore (approximately US$4.1 million) in a Series A funding round.
- The funding was led by Negen Capital and Vyom Wealth, with additional support from Venture Catalysts, SN Capital, Warmup Ventures, and Marsshot Ventures.
- Funds will be used to establish a center for advanced waste processing and to scale operations across India.
- WeVois, founded in 2018, utilizes IoT and AI to enhance waste collection and processing.
- The startup is also developing textile waste recycling facilities, focusing on converting wet waste into energy.

items.title: Buying into Indonesia’s EV market
items.author: Collin Furtado
items.summary:
- Competition in Southeast Asia’s electric vehicle (EV) market is intensifying with multiple players entering the space, including major gasoline bike manufacturers.
- Honda has launched e-scooters in Indonesia, leveraging its existing network of dealerships and service centers.
- The tightening of venture capital funding may lead to increased consolidation in the EV sector, as exemplified by the acquisition of Ion Mobility by TVS Motor at a discount after delays in launching their EV bikes.

items.title: These are the most active investors in Indonesia’s startups
items.summary:
- The article lists the most active investors in Indonesia's startups over the past two years.
- Only firms that have invested in three or more companies within Indonesia during that timeframe are featured.
- The data is regularly updated and allows for corrections from funds regarding inaccuracies.
- For more investor funding data, readers are directed to the Tech in Asia's dedicated page.

items.title: Indian seafood supply chain startup secures $2.3m debt funding
items.summary:
- Captain Fresh, an Indian seafood supply chain startup, secured 20 crore rupees (around US$2.3 million) in debt funding from VentureSoul Partners.
- This marks the third investment from VentureSoul’s initial debt fund, part of a larger funding round with equity and debt components.
- Reasons for funding included effective acquisition integration and expansion in geographic and product offerings.
- Captain Fresh's brand portfolio includes CenSea (US), Koral (Europe), and Senecrus (France).
- Major investors include Accel, Prosus, Matrix Partners, Tiger Global, and SBI Japan.

items.title: China denies data violations amid group’s TikTok concerns
items.summary:
- The Chinese government asserts it has never compelled data collection in violation of the law.
- This statement was made by a foreign ministry spokesperson on January 17.
- The response follows a complaint from the Austrian group Noyb against six Chinese companies, including TikTok, for unlawfully transferring EU user data to China.

items.title: Perplexity acquires LinkedIn’s competitor
items.summary:
- AI-powered search engine Perplexity has acquired Read.cv, a professional social media platform competing with LinkedIn.
- Read.cv was founded in 2021 by ex-Facebook and Mozilla designer Andy Chung, allowing users to share resumes, network, and create personal websites.
- This is Perplexity’s third acquisition, following Carbon and Spellwise, and reflects its focus on corporate features.

items.title: Trump launches cryptocurrency, reaches $32b valuation
items.summary:
- United States President-elect Donald Trump launched a new cryptocurrency called $Trump, achieving a market valuation of US$32 billion shortly after its introduction.
- The coin increased by over 600% within hours of its release on Jan. 18, as reported by CoinGecko.
- The cryptocurrency was introduced during the “Crypto Ball” event in Washington on Jan. 17.
- $Trump is officially endorsed by the president-elect, unlike previous Trump-themed meme coins.
- Eighty percent of the $Trump supply is held by Cic Digital, affiliated with the Trump Organization, with assets locked for three years.
- Reports suggest cryptocurrency could be a significant focus during Trump’s upcoming administration, potentially declared a “national priority.”

items.title: Israel’s top-funded tech companies in the last decade
items.summary:
- The article highlights Israel's top-funded tech companies over the past decade.
- It discusses the substantial investments these companies have received.
- The analysis may include trends in the tech sector and notable startups that emerged during this period.

items.title: US calls ChatGPT executive in Google antitrust case
items.author: Nick Turley
items.summary:
- The DOJ has called Nick Turley, head of product at OpenAI, to testify in its antitrust case against Google.
- The case follows a 2024 ruling declaring Google a monopoly in search, which Google is appealing.
- DOJ is considering potential remedies, including forcing a sale of Chrome.
- Turley's testimony will focus on generative AI's role in search, data-sharing, and market access.
- Google has subpoenaed OpenAI for documents; OpenAI contests the demand as excessive.
- A court intervention is being sought to limit Google's demands; the testimony date is pending.

items.title: Apple, Google remove TikTok from their US app stores
items.summary:
- Apple and Google removed TikTok from US app stores on Jan. 18 after a Supreme Court ban upheld.
- TikTok confirmed it has stopped operations nationwide.
- The app is no longer available for download in the US, with users receiving unavailability messages.
- Other ByteDance apps like Lemon8 are also unavailable in the US.
- President-elect Trump suggested a possible 90-day extension for TikTok to comply with laws.

items.title: Zomato invests $57.7m in Blinkit amid quick commerce race
items.summary:
- Zomato has invested $57.7 million in Blinkit, a quick commerce startup.
- This investment aims to strengthen Zomato's position in the competitive quick commerce sector.
- The deal highlights the increasing trend and investor interest in fast delivery services.
- Zomato's strategic move could reshape its market dynamics and enhance customer engagement.

items.title: OpenAI prepares to roll out o3 mini AI model
items.summary:
- OpenAI plans to release the new o3 mini AI model in the coming weeks.
- CEO Sam Altman announced that it will feature an API and integration with ChatGPT, incorporating user feedback.
- The original launch was aimed for January 2025, with a full o3 model expected to follow.
- The models aim to enhance OpenAI's capabilities in complex tasks in science, coding, and mathematics.
- This development occurs amidst rising competition from Alphabet, Google's parent company.

items.title: Creators urge Biden to protect TikTok from upcoming ban
items.summary:
- TikTok users are seeking government intervention before a ban set for January 19.
- Lawyer Jeffrey Fisher is representing content creators and has requested assurances from the Biden administration regarding TikTok's availability in app stores.
- Fisher warned that TikTok could cease operations under the new law if no action is taken.
- The letter requests protections for app stores and services from penalties while waiting for clearer guidance.
- No response has been received from the White House or the Justice Department regarding this issue.

items.title: Trump ‘most likely’ to give TikTok 90-day extension to avoid ban
items.summary:
- Trump is expected to grant TikTok a 90-day extension to avoid an outright ban.
- The extension may provide TikTok additional time for negotiations regarding its operations in the U.S.
- The move comes amid ongoing regulatory scrutiny over the app's data security practices.

items.title: Perplexity said to bid to merge with TikTok US amid looming ban
items.summary:
- Perplexity AI has proposed a merger with TikTok’s US operations.
- The bid was submitted on Jan. 18 to create a new entity with Perplexity AI, TikTok US, and capital partners.
- Current ByteDance investors would retain their equity stakes in the new entity.
- The proposed price is reportedly over US$50 billion, contingent on shareholder decisions.
- This merger strategy differs from previous proposals by ByteDance, focusing on creating a structure rather than outright sale.
- If accepted, finalizing the merger may take several months.

items.title: American EV startup Canoo files for bankruptcy, ceases operations
items.summary:
- American electric vehicle startup Canoo has filed for bankruptcy.
- The company announced it would cease operations immediately.
- Canoo faced significant financial difficulties and challenges in production.
- The bankruptcy filing affects all employees and operations of the company.

items.title: US warns of risks in Microsoft’s $13b OpenAI investment
items.summary:
- The FTC expressed concerns about the power of major tech companies in AI, including Microsoft, Amazon, and Google.
- A report released on Jan. 16 highlights risks linked to partnerships with AI startups, such as data advantages and resource consolidation.
- Risks include “lock-in” effects for startups, exclusive access to talent, sensitive data sharing, and “circular spending” benefiting tech products.
- The ongoing FTC investigation could inform future antitrust actions to promote fair competition in AI.

items.title: TikTok CEO praises Trump for support amid looming ban
items.summary:
- TikTok CEO expresses appreciation for former President Trump's support amid potential bans.
- The comments come as concerns grow over TikTok's data privacy practices.
- The platform faces scrutiny from the U.S. government regarding national security risks.

items.title: China tightens export restrictions impacting Apple’s supply
items.summary:
- China has imposed restrictions on personnel and specialized equipment movement for high-tech manufacturing to India and Southeast Asia.
- The measures aim to prevent production shifts due to potential U.S. tariffs under President-elect Trump.
- Foxconn, Apple's main assembly partner, cannot send staff to India or receive machinery for its factories.
- India is crucial to Apple's strategy to reduce reliance on China; Foxconn's Chennai plant is responsible for half of India's iPhone exports.
- China is trying to prevent Foxconn from diversifying further as its operations are key to local employment and the electronics supply chain.
- The restrictions have also affected the manufacturing of electric vehicles and solar panels in India, impacting companies like BYD and Waaree Energies.

items.title: Biden’s $52b Chips Act entering new phase under Trump
items.summary:
- Biden's $52 billion Chips Act is entering a new phase under the Trump administration.
- The Act aims to bolster semiconductor manufacturing in the U.S.
- Key provisions of the Act focus on increasing domestic production and reducing reliance on foreign supply chains.

items.title: VinFast launches two EV models in India
US settles $20m privacy case with Genshin Impact developer
items.summary:
- Cognosphere, developer of "Genshin Impact," settles for US$20 million with the FTC over children's privacy law violations.
- Allegations include misleading marketing of loot boxes to minors without disclosing real costs or prize odds.
- Settlement mandates blocking users under 16 from in-game purchases without parental consent, announced on Jan. 17.

items.title: Variety is the spice of life 🌶️
items.summary:
- Multiple industries receive funding, including medical and gaming.
- Neuberg Diagnostics secured US$109 million in investment from Kotak Investment Advisors.
- Cornerstone Robotics closed US$70 million in series C funding.
- Mirxes received US$40 million for cancer diagnostics in Asia.
- Grand Games obtained US$30 million in series A funding.
- PrettyDamnQuick raised US$25 million led by PeakSpan Capital.
- Over US$570 million in 59 funding deals reported this week.

items.title: These are the most active investors in Singapore’s startups
items.summary:
- This article lists the most active investors in Singapore's startups over the past two years.
- The list ranks firms by the number of deals made, favoring early-stage investors.
- Only firms that have invested in three or more companies in Singapore are included in the list.
- The article encourages readers to provide corrections or missing information via email.

items.title: TikTok, Shein, others sued over unlawful data transfers to China
items.summary:
- Austrian advocacy group Noyb filed complaints on Jan. 16 against six Chinese companies for unlawful EU user data transfers to China.
- Companies involved include TikTok, AliExpress, Shein, Xiaomi, Temu, and WeChat.
- Noyb claims TikTok, Shein, Xiaomi, and AliExpress acknowledge sending user data to China, while Temu and WeChat send it to unnamed 'third countries'.
- Under the EU's GDPR, data transfers outside the EU are permissible only if the recipient country meets EU data protection standards, which Noyb argues China does not.

items.title: Biden passes TikTok ban enforcement to Trump administration
items.summary:
- The Biden administration transfers TikTok ban enforcement to President-elect Donald Trump, effective Jan. 19.
- Supreme Court upholds legislation requiring ByteDance to divest for national security reasons.
- Enforcement responsibilities remain unclear with Trump set to take office just before the ban.
- The Biden administration shows hesitation in imposing penalties for non-compliance with the TikTok ban.
- Trump's stance on TikTok enforcement remains uncertain, considering previous support for a ban.
- TikTok’s future operations are uncertain, with potential reports of app shutdowns but no official announcements.

items.title: JD.com unveils gifting feature ahead of Lunar New Year
items.summary:
- JD.com introduced a new gifting feature just in time for the Lunar New Year.
- The feature aims to enhance the shopping experience during the festive season.
- This development is part of JD.com's strategy to boost sales around the holiday.
